conclusion: Problem involves two cars, A and B, traveling in the same direction with given v-t graphs.
At t=30 seconds, cars are side by side, indicating equal displacement by that time.
Understanding v-t graphs: velocity on y-axis, time on x-axis, area under graph gives displacement.
Car A has a horizontal line at 40 m/s, indicating constant velocity after some time.
Car B has a straight line from origin, indicating constant acceleration.
At t=30 seconds, area under each graph should be equal since cars are side by side.
Goal is to find positions of cars relative to each other at t=10 seconds.
Calculate displacement for car A up to t=30 seconds in two parts: acceleration and constant velocity.
Car A's displacement from t=0 to t=10 seconds is 200 meters.
Car A's displacement from t=10 to t=30 seconds is 800 meters.
Total displacement for car A up to t=30 seconds is 1000 meters.
Car B's displacement up to t=30 seconds must also be 1000 meters.
Assume car B has constant acceleration 'a'.
Car B's displacement formula: s = (1/2)*a*(30)² = 450*a meters.
Set car B's displacement equal to 1000 meters to find acceleration.
Calculate car B's acceleration: a = 1000/450 ≈ 2.222 m/s².
Find displacement of car A at t=10 seconds: 200 meters.
Calculate car B's displacement at t=10 seconds: 111.111 meters.
At t=10 seconds, car A is ahead by 88.889 meters.
